sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Anger erupts across Israel after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu sacks his defence minister for challenging a controversial judicial reform plan.

sentences.sentence: The EU threatens further sanctions against Russia after President Vladimir Putin announces plans to move nuclear weapons to neighbouring Belarus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Tens of thousands of Israelis poured onto the streets of cities across the country on Sunday night in an outburst of anger.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It followed the sacking of Israel's defense minister by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu for challenging the leader's judicial overhaul plan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Protesters in Tel Aviv blocked a main highway and lit large bonfires, while police scuffled with crowds outside Netanyahu's private home in Jerusalem.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In a brief televised statement on Saturday, the now former defense minister, Yoav Galant, had warned that weeks of protests to the judicial plan were a security threat and should be scrapped.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Netanyahu's government is to hold a parliamentary vote this week on a centerpiece of the overhaul, a law that will give the governing coalition the final say over all judicial appointments. sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Croatia's airports dropped internal border controls on Sunday for passengers travelling to or from the Schengen zone, a move that has been welcomed by the country's tourism sector.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The Balkan country officially joined the zone on the 1st of January, but didn't lift its air border checks until Sunday in order to align the date with the summer flight schedules.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Planes departing to or arriving from the area will now be treated as domestic flights.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: This means that passengers flying to and from European cities will not have to go through border checks, but only security controls before boarding the plane.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: will not have to go through border checks but only security controls before boarding the plane. The country's largest airport in the capital Zagreb has made significant investments in updating its terminals in anticipation for a bounce back to post-covid tourist numbers this summer. The Schengen area is the world's largest free travel zone made up of 27 countries including 22 EU states, Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway and Switzerland.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Just under two million people live in one country inside the zone and work in another.
